$STORAGE_FORMAT.description: The on-disk storage format of a data set

Q_ANTIBODY.description: List of antibodies used in different sample preparations

Q_ATTACHMENT_TYPES.description: Different types of unstructured data attachments, for example results or experimental design data

Q_BMI_MODALITIES.description: Distinguishes imaging experiments with respect to their modality (CT guided biopsy, dynamic CT, MR, PET, MR-PET).

Q_BMI_PET_TRACERS.description: In case of PET, several tracers can be employed. This CV enumerates available PET tracer compounds.

Q_CHROMATOGRAPHY_TYPES.description: A list of chromatography-based separation techniques.

Q_DEMUX_SOFTWARES.description: A list of demultiplexing software solutions and versions.

Q_DIGESTION_PROTEASES.description: Common proteases or other chemicals used to digest proteins into peptides. Used in MS experiments.

Q_EXPERIMENT_STATES.description: Describes the current status of the experiment's progress.

Q_IONIZATION_MODES.description: Plainly offers positive and negative mode ionization as options.

Q_LABELING_TYPES.description: Labeling of samples using isotopes, fluorescence or other methods.

Q_LIBRARY_PREPKITS.description: A list of library preparation kits for sequencing.

Q_MS_CONTROL_SOFTWARES.description: A list of MS instrument control softwares and their versions.

Q_MS_CONVERSION_SOFTWARES.description: A list of softwares (and versions) used for MS data conversion.

Q_MS_DEVICES.description: A list of mass spectrometers available to QBiC.

Q_MS_ENRICHMENT_PROTOCOLS.description: Enrichment of peptides or proteins of different characteristics

Q_MS_FRACTIONATION_PROTOCOLS.description: Different methods of fractionating mass spectrometry samples

Q_MS_LCMS_METHODS.description: Labratory specific methods for LCMS measurements

Q_MS_PROTOCOLS.description: A list of common MS protocols.

Q_MS_RAW_VENDOR_TYPES.description:
Raw data types produced by the different vendor types. Used for conversion and workflow purposes.
Marc Rurik:
von den 5 großen Herstellern von Massenspektrometern gibt es mindestens die folgenden Rohdatenformate:

AB SCIEX: WIFF, T2D (DataExplorer) 
Agilent: .d Verzeichnis (MassHunter)
Bruker: .d Verzeichnis (Compass), YEP, BAF, FID
Thermo: RAW
Waters: RAW Verzeichnis (MassLynx)

Wichtig ist wahrscheinlich nur das für jeden Hersteller zuerst genannte Format, zumindest hab ich die anderen noch nie gesehen. Drei der Formate sind tatsächlich Verzeichnisse, können beim Konvertieren aber wie Dateien betrachtet werden und erzeugen auch nur eine .mzML. Das .d-Format von Agilent und das .d-Format von Bruker sind übrigens nicht das gleiche und genauso auch nicht die beiden RAW-Formate von Thermo und Waters. Außerdem müssen beim .wiff-Format ggf. weitere Dateien (.wiff.scan) neben der .wiff-Datei im gleichen Verzeichnis liegen. Hier kann es leicht zu Problemen kommen, wenn Dateien nachträglich umbenannt werden.

Q_NCBI_TAXONOMY.description: Specifies the studied organism according to the NCBI taxonomy (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Taxonomy).

Q_NGS_FLOW_CELL_TYPE.description: Product ID of a flow cell used in next generation sequencing

Q_PRIMARY_TISSUES.description: A list of tissues and body fluids a taken can be taken from.

Q_SAMPLE_PREPARATION.description: Common methods of performing sample preparation

Q_SAMPLE_PROCESS_STATES.description: This is a CV containing names of process states that a sample (usually only physical samples such as Q_BIOLOGICAL_SAMPLE and Q_TEST_SAMPLE) can pass through. Each state has a prefix to distinguish the process it belongs to (e.g., the MSH prefix is used for MultiscaleHCC-related processes).

Q_SAMPLE_TYPES.description: List of sample content types that are commonly extracted/enriched to suit a specific analytic method (e.g. protein extract for proteomics studies).

Q_SEQUENCER_DEVICES.description: A regularly updated list of all sequencer devices QBiC has access to.

Q_SEQUENCER_SOFTWARES.description: Specifies the sequencer's control software version (e.g., HiSeq Control Software) that was used for the measurement.

Q_SEQUENCING_CHEMISTRY_TYPES.description: A list of chemistry types that can be used for sequencing.

Q_SEQUENCING_MODES.description: Allows the selection of single-end or paired-end.

Q_TIMEPOINTS.description: A simple CV to model an ordinal variable representing time of measurement (T0, T1, ...)

SEQUENCING_TYPE.description: The type of the sequencing experiment: RNA or Exome

TREATMENT_TYPE.description: Type of treatment of a biological sample.
